Abstract: Cohoes Bancorp Inc says it set one-year repurchase program for 10 percent of its common stock; buyback is company's third in last six months (S)
Snippet: Cohoes Bancorp Inc says it set one-year repurchase program for 10 percent of its common stock; buyback is company's third in last six months (S)
LeadParagraph: Cohoes Bancorp Inc., an upstate New York bank with 21 branches, said yesterday that it had set a one-year repurchase program for about 10 percent of its common stock. The company, the parent of Cohoes Savings Bank, would pay about $9.1 million for the shares based on yesterday's closing price of $10.0625, up 31.25 cents. The buyback is the company's third in the last six months. The company had about nine million common shares outstanding as of Nov. 1, according to a Securities and Exchange Commission filing.

Headline.Main: COHOES BANCORP TO BUY BACK 10 PERCENT OF ITS STOCK
Headline.PrintHeadline: COMPANY NEWS; COHOES BANCORP TO BUY BACK 10 PERCENT OF ITS STOCK
